summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) of a correctional officer (CO) regarding the events and procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The CO discusses shift changes, the failure to conduct proper counts and rounds, the discovery that Epstein's cellmate was missing, and institutional practices like prefilling paperwork.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died by suicide in the SHU. The document details the failure to provide him with a cellmate and to conduct proper monitoring rounds on the night of his death.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A CO working the evening watch in the SHU on August 9. The interviewee states Noel was filling out round sheets and was aware Epstein needed a cellmate.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Referred to as 'Noel' in the document. Worked the evening shift in the SHU and was involved in monitoring Epstein and paperwork.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: The interviewee, referred to as 'CO Thomas' or 'Thomas'. He was the number one CO/OIC in the SHU on the evening of August 9. He discusses discovering Epstein's missing cellmate and calling a supervisor.

connections.description: Worked together on the evening watch in the SHU on August 9. Thomas instructed Noel and another CO to monitor Epstein.

Thomas was the officer-in-charge responsible for Epstein's housing and monitoring on the night of his death. He placed Epstein in a shower to use a phone and later discovered his cellmate was missing.
Noel was one of the correctional officers assigned to monitor Epstein and conduct rounds in the SHU on the night of his death.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day in SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was held in the SHU, was allowed a social phone call in a shower area, was returned to his cell without a cellmate, and was later found deceased.

events.title: Failure to Conduct 4pm Count
events.description: CO Thomas prefilled the 4pm count sheet but admits the count was never actually conducted, and the inmate number on the sheet was wrong.

events.title: Discovery of Missing Cellmate
events.description: Around 9:30 PM, when returning Epstein to his cell from the shower, CO Thomas discovered Epstein's cellmate was missing and claims he notified other COs and called a supervisor.

events.title: SHU and Suicide Prevention Training
events.description: CO Thomas received SHU and suicide prevention training in 2019, prior to the Epstein incident.

keyFacts: CO Michael Thomas discovered Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate was missing around 9:30 PM on August 9, when he returned Epstein to his cell from a shower area used for a phone call.
Thomas admits he prefilled the 4pm inmate count sheet on August 9 but the count was never actually conducted, and the number on the sheet was incorrect.
Thomas states that based on his review of the paperwork, he now believes the evening watch round sheets were likely prefilled by other officers.
Thomas claims he notified other COs (Noel and another) and called a supervisor (possibly a Lieutenant) to report Epstein's missing cellmate, but cannot recall exactly who he spoke with.

The document reveals institutional issues at the MCC SHU, including chronic understaffing, pressure to cut corners, and a history of officers prefilling count and round sheets without performing the actual checks.
